summary: Cosplays We Like: Game of Thrones
title: Cosplays We Like: Game of Thrones
body:
Cosplays We Like: Game of Thrones - “Winter is coming” so we thought we’d showcase some of the cosplays we like from the Game of Thrones franchise.

With winter coming….I mean season 8 of the phenomenal hit show Game of Thrones. We thought we showcase some of the cosplays we like from cosplayer who have cosplayed characters from the show. Enjoy.

View this post on Instagram

“I was never going to be as good a lady as you. So I had to become someone else.” Arya Stark — Picture by @lichtreserven #cosplay #arya #stark…

View On WordPress

summary: From The Ashes ~ Chapter 24 Read it here Tamara Arryn is married to Jaime Lannister in the midst of her investigations regarding...
caption:
From The Ashes ~ Chapter 24

Read it here

Tamara Arryn is married to Jaime Lannister in the midst of her investigations regarding her father’s death. When she becomes Warden of the East, everything will change. As Lady of the Eyrie, Tamara will decide the formerly neutral Vale’s allegiance - and Westeros’s future. Yet she finds herself drawn to the man she swore always to hate.

summary: I'm a Jonsa fan, so excuse me for being biased, but when Pol!Jon is revealed and Dany's already been made a fool of, imagine how...
question: I'm a Jonsa fan, so excuse me for being biased, but when Pol!Jon is revealed and Dany's already been made a fool of, imagine how much worse it's going to be for her if it's revealed that Jon's in love with Sansa? She always looked down on Elia because Rhaegar dumped her for Lyanna, and even bragged that if he had been married to her, he never would have strayed with some "Stark Girl." Now, she'll be the 'Elia' in another love triangle involving a Targ Prince and a Lady Stark. Talk about karma.
answer: I don’t how I feel about this. Dany was raised by Viserys who was a child in Aerys’ court and probably heard a lot of racist talk about Elia and show Dany has never talked about Elia that way so I don’t see where the karma comes in. Elia was deeply humiliated by Rhaegar and he repeatedly put her in danger and probably approved of his father imprisoning her. Jon breaking up with Dany for presumably Sansa isn’t the same situation. While yeah it can be funny for Dany find herself in the same position as Elia, Dany isn’t a brown disabled woman so the circumstance is very different.

reblog.comment: I don’t how I feel about this. Dany was raised by Viserys who was a child in Aerys’ court and probably heard a lot of racist talk about Elia and show Dany has never talked about Elia that way so I don’t see where the karma comes in. Elia was deeply humiliated by Rhaegar and he repeatedly put her in danger and probably approved of his father imprisoning her. Jon breaking up with Dany for presumably Sansa isn’t the same situation. While yeah it can be funny for Dany find herself in the same position as Elia, Dany isn’t a brown disabled woman so the circumstance is very different.

Elia was deeply humiliated by Rhaegar and he repeatedly put her in danger and probably approved of his father imprisoning her. Jon breaking up with Dany for presumably Sansa isn’t the same situation. While yeah it can be funny for Dany find herself in the same position as Elia, Dany isn’t a brown disabled woman so the circumstance is very different.

Elia was deeply humiliated by Rhaegar and he repeatedly put her in danger and probably approved of his father imprisoning her. Jon breaking up with Dany for presumably Sansa isn’t the same situation. While yeah it can be funny for Dany find herself in the same position as Elia, Dany isn’t a brown disabled woman so the circumstance is very different.

summary: JONSA MODERN!AU // worth trusting   Jon survived clinical death and she went the most sickening marriage. Perhaps that’s why...
caption:
JONSA MODERN!AU // worth trusting

Jon survived clinical death and she went the most sickening marriage. Perhaps that’s why they came to their senses. Jon suddenly remembered the events of five years ago and began to reassemble the evidence that his father had been killed. He didn’t believe in the overdosage version from the very beginning — that’s what he was trying to tell Sansa when he met her at the hospital, where she was sitting with Bran until Petyr called. Oh, how perfectly he simulated compassion, what pity filled his voice! How much care, how many valuable lessons, how many lies. Baelish said, his plan was flawless: as soon Sansa warms herself into the Bolton’s confidence, little by little she would assume control of the former Stark Industries, and Ramsay is a perfectly respectable and well-educated young man. Educated bastard. How many stupid things she had done, blindly trusting those who should not be trusted and completely forgetting —  effacing him from her mind, as if he had never existed — the only person who was worth trusting. He gave everything back to her: the family business, her good name, their estate. Just because he didn’t want Father’s ghost to come and murder him. Jon was about to leave, but Sansa couldn’t let this happen, almost forcibly appointing him the CEO of their Father’s corporation. Together they make it work somehow. People get jobs, feel stability and confidence in the future. It’s a cliché, but these worn-out words make sense of everything they do. And people are grateful because the North remembers.

summary: I just want to know why Sansa is still being blamed for Ned's death?? Like how, Ned's dumbass was warned by Varys and fucking...
question: I just want to know why Sansa is still being blamed for Ned's death?? Like how, Ned's dumbass was warned by Varys and fucking Littlefinger but what does the old fool do, proceeds to announce his plans to Cersei and stupidly think she'll do nothing. Ned was set up himself, he, not Sansa the adult is to blame(obviously Joffrey is a shit and is to blame too) Cersei was put in a corner by good ol Ned and she had no option. I hate anti Sansa's and their bloody dumb logic.
